required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study Comparing Two Implant Surface Finishes in Patients Undergoing Cementless Total Hip Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized Study of Summit™ Porocoat® Versus Summit™ DuoFix™ HA in Cementless Total Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized study of Summit Porocoat versus Summit DuoFix HA in total hip arthroplasty

detailed_description.textblock: Hydroxyapatite (HA) is a bioactive ceramic that resembles the natural inorganic mineral content of bone, and as such is a highly osteoconductive material. The purpose of this study is to compare an HA coated and uncoated prosthesis.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Terminated due to limited enrollment and follow up.

primary_outcome.description: The Harris Hip scoring system assigns a numeric value to responses from patients and assessments made by a surgeon. A score of 90-100 is excellent, 80-90 is good, 70-80 is fair, 60-69 is poor, and 60 or below is failed. The patient records the following: pain level, need for assistance when walking, presence of a limp, distance able to walk, ability to put on shoes and socks, climb stairs, use public transportation and the length of time one is able to comforatably sit in a chair are all scored. The doctor assesses patient hip function by testing flexion, extension, adduction and abduction.

intervention.other_name: Summit Porocoated porous coated hip stem.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary total hip replacement
- Patient age less than or equal to 75
- Sufficient bone stock to support prosthesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous hip replacement
- Significant angular/bony deformity
- Active joint sepsis
- Metal allergy
- Renal transplant
- Psychosocial disease
- Neurological disease/musculoskeletal disease that may affect weight-bearing

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment began in September 2002 and ended June 2006. Study subjects were recruited and enrolled in medical clinics by orthopaedic surgeons at eight investigational sites. Each site could enroll a maximum of 50 subjects. Recruitment was based on the inclusion and exclusion criteria as indicated in the study protocol.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Immediately before surgery, the implant type was determined according to the randomization schedule. Enrolled subjects may have been excluded from the trial before assignment to the study arm based upon results of pre-operative clinical evaluations and radiographs that would exclude a subject based on exclusion criteria in the study protocol.

group.title: DuoFix HA
group.description: The Summit™ DuoFix™ HA stems are primary, cementless hip implants. Summit™ cementless stems feature 3°-tapered body geometry to enhance fit, and are manufactured from forged titanium alloy. The Summit™ cementless stems are designed to load the femur toward the upper part of the stem, and therefore the Porocoat® porous coating is applied only to the upper body of the stem. The DuoFix™ HA stem also has a thin coating of hydroxyapatite on this porous-coated surface. This HA coating is only 35 microns thick, so the optimum pore size is maintained. The lower portion of the stem has a grit-blasted surface, which promotes bone on-growth and the polished bullet-tip prevents end-stem loading.

group.title: Porocoat Porous Coated
group.description: The Summit™ Porocoat® stems are primary, cementless hip implants that a feature 3°-tapered body geometry to enhance fit, and are manufactured from forged titanium alloy. The Summit™ cementless stems are designed to load the femur toward the upper part of the stem, and therefore the Porocoat® porous coating is applied only to the upper body of the stem. The lower portion of the stems has a grit-blasted surface, which promotes bone on-growth and the polished bullet-tip prevents end-stem loading.

participants_list.participants: 400 subjects were to be followed for 5 years; due to slow enrollment study closed early with 245.
400 subjects were to be followed for 5 years; due to slow enrollment study closed early with 245.

group.title: DuoFix HA
group.description: The Summit™ DuoFix™ HA stems are primary, cementless hip implants. Summit™ cementless stems feature 3°-tapered body geometry to enhance fit, and are manufactured from forged titanium alloy. The Summit™ cementless stems are designed to load the femur toward the upper part of the stem, and therefore the Porocoat® porous coating is applied only to the upper body of the stem. The DuoFix™ HA stem also has a thin coating of hydroxyapatite on this porous-coated surface. This HA coating is only 35 microns thick, so the optimum pore size is maintained. The lower portion of the stem has a grit-blasted surface, which promotes bone on-growth and the polished bullet-tip prevents end-stem loading.

group.title: Porocoat Porous Coated
group.description: The Summit™ Porocoat® stems are primary, cementless hip implants that a feature 3°-tapered body geometry to enhance fit, and are manufactured from forged titanium alloy. The Summit™ cementless stems are designed to load the femur toward the upper part of the stem, and therefore the Porocoat® porous coating is applied only to the upper body of the stem. The lower portion of the stems has a grit-blasted surface, which promotes bone on-growth and the polished bullet-tip prevents end-stem loading.

outcome.title: Harris Hip Score (HHS)
outcome.description: The Harris Hip scoring system assigns a numeric value to responses from patients and assessments made by a surgeon. A score of 90-100 is excellent, 80-90 is good, 70-80 is fair, 60-69 is poor, and 60 or below is failed. The patient records the following: pain level, need for assistance when walking, presence of a limp, distance able to walk, ability to put on shoes and socks, climb stairs, use public transportation and the length of time one is able to comforatably sit in a chair are all scored. The doctor assesses patient hip function by testing flexion, extension, adduction and abduction.
outcome.population: Before the first interval there were five missing HHS scores for the DuoFix arm and four missing HHS scores for the Porocoat Porous Coated arm. At the final interval (60 months), there were eleven subjects in the DuoFix arm with complete HHS scores and there were fourteen subjects in the Porocoat Porous Coated arm with complete HHS scores.

The patient records the following: pain level, need for assistance when walking, presence of a limp, distance able to walk, ability to put on shoes and socks, climb stairs, use public transportation and the length of time one is able to comforatably sit in a chair are all scored. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The protocol called for 400 subjects to be followed for 5 years, but due to slow enrollment the study closed early. 245 subjects were enrolled & study endpoint was modified to 2 years. Enrollment closed on June 30, 2006; study closed on Jan 29, 2009.
